text: The ongoing COVID-19 pandemic was first confirmed to have spread to Costa Rica on 6 March 2020, after a 49-year-old woman tourist from New York, United States, tested positive for the virus. As of 13 May 2020, Costa Rica has reported 815 positive cases, 527 recoveries, and 7 deaths. One senior citizen, an 87-year-old man, died on 18 March and is the first COVID-19 death in Costa Rica. He was one of 25 people infected by a doctor in Alajuela. By 30 April, the country had the lowest case fatality rate in the Americas, at about 0.86%. More Costa Ricans have died in the United States than in Costa Rica. ==References== Category:21st century in Costa Rica Costa Rica
title: COVID-19 pandemic in Costa Rica
